programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: It's sink or swim for the trainees as they face the daunting Water Power Challenge, aptly named Sink or Swim - and one trainee is tempted to ditch their Warrior.

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Romance is in the air as a new trainee turns up the heat and, in the most brutal challenge yet, some trainees are pushed to breaking point. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima.

programme.title: Squad Goals: Dorking 'Til I Die
programme.desc: Dorking take on local rivals Sutton in a crucial game for the league. Charlotte is substituted with a medical condition, and off the pitch, Calum raises funds for the club.

programme.title: Squad Goals: Dorking 'Til I Die
programme.desc: Dorking Ladies are on a losing streak and team morale is low. Calum takes drastic action to avoid the season ending in tatters, Bianca is back dating and Jas aims to get match fit.

programme.title: My Mate's a Bad Date
programme.desc: Oloni has his work cut out with Vicky as he helps her find her perfect match, hoping to change her behaviour and her unrealistic criteria for her suitors.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney receive their baby's test results and Nish and Suki's marriage blessing ceremony is brought forward. A guilt-riddled Denise seduces Jack, and Denzel is shortlisted for 'The Walford Young Writers Competition'.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney makes a difficult decision and Denzel's lies are exposed. Stacey and Eve re-open the bap van but chaos ensues when Nish accosts Eve while she's working. After Nish invites Honey to the marriage blessing, Suki is left in an awkward position.

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant (2016)
programme.desc: Rebels fighting for freedom in a strictly ordered society escapes from the walled city they live in. They find themselves in a strange and dangerous new world, where they face a battle for their own survival and of those they have left behind. Third in the sci-fi adventure series based on Veronica Roth's novels, starring Shailene Woodley, Theo James and Naomi Watts.

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Tim enlists the help of a phone app in his search for a boyfriend, but problems arise once he meets a potential partner. Billy's relationship with Cassie proves a distraction from football training, and Donna tries to find a new best friend she can confide in. Starring Luke Gell.

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz has a party to mark his 30th birthday, but the celebratory mood ends as he reflects on his lack of achievements over the years. Donna visits the doctor and is left reeling by the news she receives, Tim is stunned when Leonard asks him out on a date, and Cassie's relationship with Billy is threatened by the appearance of her ex-boyfriend.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Ex-Geordie Shore reality star Charlotte Crosby showcases her home town of Sunderland, life with her family and partner Jake and her extraordinary social life. She also outlines the progress of her growing business empire but when she receives some life changing news, how will she respond?.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: After an emotional scan, Charlotte announces her pregnancy to the world and her best friend Lauren is called in to help with a grand plan to take over York Fashion Week. Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Tensions are high at dinner with Charlotte's parents as she's gone way over budget for the fashion show. Jake has finally moved into the Crosby Manor, but there's little time to waste as they head to York Fashion Week.

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: It's sink or swim for the trainees as they face the daunting Water Power Challenge, aptly named Sink or Swim - and one trainee is tempted to ditch their Warrior.

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Romance is in the air as a new trainee turns up the heat and, in the most brutal challenge yet, some trainees are pushed to breaking point. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima.

programme.title: Squad Goals: Dorking 'Til I Die
programme.desc: Dorking take on local rivals Sutton in a crucial game for the league. Charlotte is substituted with a medical condition, and off the pitch, Calum raises funds for the club.

programme.title: Squad Goals: Dorking 'Til I Die
programme.desc: Dorking Ladies are on a losing streak and team morale is low. Calum takes drastic action to avoid the season ending in tatters, Bianca is back dating and Jas aims to get match fit.

programme.title: My Mate's a Bad Date
programme.desc: Oloni has his work cut out with Vicky as he helps her find her perfect match, hoping to change her behaviour and her unrealistic criteria for her suitors.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney receive their baby's test results and Nish and Suki's marriage blessing ceremony is brought forward. A guilt-riddled Denise seduces Jack, and Denzel is shortlisted for 'The Walford Young Writers Competition'.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney makes a difficult decision and Denzel's lies are exposed. Stacey and Eve re-open the bap van but chaos ensues when Nish accosts Eve while she's working. After Nish invites Honey to the marriage blessing, Suki is left in an awkward position.

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant (2016)
programme.desc: Rebels fighting for freedom in a strictly ordered society escapes from the walled city they live in. They find themselves in a strange and dangerous new world, where they face a battle for their own survival and of those they have left behind. Third in the sci-fi adventure series based on Veronica Roth's novels, starring Shailene Woodley, Theo James and Naomi Watts.

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Tim enlists the help of a phone app in his search for a boyfriend, but problems arise once he meets a potential partner. Billy's relationship with Cassie proves a distraction from football training, and Donna tries to find a new best friend she can confide in. Starring Luke Gell.

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz has a party to mark his 30th birthday, but the celebratory mood ends as he reflects on his lack of achievements over the years. Donna visits the doctor and is left reeling by the news she receives, Tim is stunned when Leonard asks him out on a date, and Cassie's relationship with Billy is threatened by the appearance of her ex-boyfriend.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Ex-Geordie Shore reality star Charlotte Crosby showcases her home town of Sunderland, life with her family and partner Jake and her extraordinary social life. She also outlines the progress of her growing business empire but when she receives some life changing news, how will she respond?.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: After an emotional scan, Charlotte announces her pregnancy to the world and her best friend Lauren is called in to help with a grand plan to take over York Fashion Week. Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom.

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Tensions are high at dinner with Charlotte's parents as she's gone way over budget for the fashion show. Jake has finally moved into the Crosby Manor, but there's little time to waste as they head to York Fashion Week.

programme.title: The Human Voice (2020)
programme.desc: A woman waiting for her ex-lover to collect his suitcases from her flat gets one last chance to speak to him over the phone, while the couple's dog watches, unable to comprehend that his master has abandoned them. Pedro Almodóvar's short film based on Jean Cocteau's play, starring Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Crisis pregnancy advice centres are supposed to help women with unplanned pregnancies, but an investigation reveals evidence that some clinics, operating outside the NHS, are giving misleading information and offering counselling that could persuade women not to have abortions. Reporter Divya Talwar also uncovers links between some UK centres and the anti-abortion movement in America.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Copies of a pornographic pamphlet circulate Versailles depicting Chartres as the Queen's lover and father to the unborn child, cuckolding the King. Louis locks down the château, and Antoinette's many enemies are questioned. Yolande vies against Lamballe to be closest to the troubled ruler.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Fearing an outbreak of scurvy, the crew stops in St Augustine, where the search for citrus leads to a run-in with a major figure from Jim's past. Meanwhile, after learning that Blackbeard is ready to move on to his next adventure, Stede forces his pirate friend and Lucius on a treasure hunt. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Rhys Darby.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place.

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's global journey culminates in a visit to Antarctica, the land of extremes. The presenter tackles freezing conditions to explore the underwater world of an iceberg, has an encounter with a group of humpback whales, and fulfils a lifelong ambition by diving with one of the greatest predators to inhabit the waters - the leopard seal.

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The Wyoming Wetlands Society is a non-profit organisation that relocates beavers that have been damaging expensive landscaped areas and flooding yards and roads with their dam-building activities in Teton County. This documentary follows the work of Drew Reed as he traps the problem animals and takes them to drainage areas of the Gros Ventre River, where the beavers help to restore and enhance wetland habitats, providing many direct and indirect benefits to both wildlife and people. Rob Brydon narrates.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits.

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts a star-studded version of the culinary contest, which sees Mary Berry, Chris Bavin and Angela Hartnett judging 10 famous cooks. Taking part are Ferne McCann, Gareth Thomas, Desiree Burch, Ed Balls, Karim Zeroual, Ruth Madeley, Tom Read Wilson, Shobna Gulati, Ed Byrne and Rachel Johnson. In this first edition, Mary wants to know what home cooking means to the contestants, so she challenges them to produce their ultimate home-cooked dinner.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Medals are decided in the women's triple jump, 1500m and 400m and the men's 400m and 600m. Reigning Olympic 100m champion Marcell Jacobs of Italy claimed an emphatic victory over 60m when the event was last held two years ago in Poland. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedian Lucy Porter and Chaser Jenny Ryan visit antique shops in south Wales. On hand to help are experts Serhat Ahmet and Steven Moore. An alcohol-themed spending spree sees both celebrity trippers purchasing items once used for marketing boozy products. However, they buy classy objects too, including something originating from Buckingham Palace and some quite pricy oak library steps.

programme.title: Universe
programme.sub-title: The Milky Way: Island of Light
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores the Milky Way, using data from a cutting-edge space telescope to reveal the dramatic history of Earth's galaxy, and predict its cataclysmic future. The European Space Agency's Gaia Space Telescope painstakingly measures the true position of over a billion stars, producing the most accurate map of the Milky Way ever created, while also measuring their movement, allowing their positions to be tracked back through time.

programme.title: Dionne Warwick - Don't Make Me Over
programme.desc: Profile of the singer whose career has spanned more than four decades with hits such as Alfie, Walk On By and That's What Friends Are For. Featuring contributions from friends, family and collaborators including Burt Bacharach, Tom Jones, Gloria Estefan, Quincy Jones and Michael Caine.

programme.title: Dionne Warwick at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances on BBC programmes by the singer, featuring Heartbreaker, Always Something There to Remind Me, Anyone Who Had a Heart, All the Love in the World, and That's What Friends Are For with Elton John.

programme.title: Fern Britton Meets
programme.desc: The singer looks back on her 50-year career, which began with the release in 1962 of her first single Don't Make Me Over and has most recently seen her re-record some of her best-known hits. The entertainer also discusses the death of her cousin Whitney Houston earlier this year, fighting racism, and the importance of her Christian faith.

programme.title: The Human Voice (2020)

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Actor Adam Woodyatt swaps the Walford skyline for Northern Ireland's spectacular causeway coast, as he checks into the B&B. Chef Alex needs Adam's help to prepare an Indian inspired feast, but they're still missing a few key ingredients. Luckily host Sharon knows a local farm that might be able to help. Alex makes use of Adam's newfound passion for cooking preparing an Indian spiced goat curry with yoghurt flat breads. The next day, Adam enjoys a workout on the beach. Accompanied by some local fitness enthusiasts, he's put through his paces with a special fitness session.

programme.title: Food Fest Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman discover tips and treats at the food and music festival in Newcastle, Co Down. They find out how to create award-winning burgers, discover the secrets of poutine, and how one man uses local produce to flavour his own special brand of chocolate. Chef Suzie Lee is down the road in Kilkeel to reveal exactly what scampi is and Ryan Hand finds out the superpowers of seeds.

programme.sub-title: The Milky Way: Island of Light

The presenter tackles freezing conditions to explore the underwater world of an iceberg, has an encounter with a group of humpback whales, and fulfils a lifelong ambition by diving with one of the greatest predators to inhabit the waters - the leopard seal.

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The Wyoming Wetlands Society is a non-profit organisation that relocates beavers that have been damaging expensive landscaped areas and flooding yards and roads with their dam-building activities in Teton County. This documentary follows the work of Drew Reed as he traps the problem animals and takes them to drainage areas of the Gros Ventre River, where the beavers help to restore and enhance wetland habitats, providing many direct and indirect benefits to both wildlife and people. Rob Brydon narrates.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits.

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts a star-studded version of the culinary contest, which sees Mary Berry, Chris Bavin and Angela Hartnett judging 10 famous cooks. Taking part are Ferne McCann, Gareth Thomas, Desiree Burch, Ed Balls, Karim Zeroual, Ruth Madeley, Tom Read Wilson, Shobna Gulati, Ed Byrne and Rachel Johnson. In this first edition, Mary wants to know what home cooking means to the contestants, so she challenges them to produce their ultimate home-cooked dinner.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex.

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Medals are decided in the women's triple jump, 1500m and 400m and the men's 400m and 600m. Reigning Olympic 100m champion Marcell Jacobs of Italy claimed an emphatic victory over 60m when the event was last held two years ago in Poland. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before - loofahs. Joe Swift visits a garden where the contemporary and traditional meet. And Advolly Richmond discovers a stunning Japanese-inspired garden.

programme.title: Universe
programme.sub-title: The Milky Way: Island of Light
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores the Milky Way, using data from a cutting-edge space telescope to reveal the dramatic history of Earth's galaxy, and predict its cataclysmic future. The European Space Agency's Gaia Space Telescope painstakingly measures the true position of over a billion stars, producing the most accurate map of the Milky Way ever created, while also measuring their movement, allowing their positions to be tracked back through time.

programme.title: Wynne Evans: For One Night Only
programme.desc: Singer, radio presenter and comedy performer Wynne Evans celebrates St David's Day with a show full of music and laughter at St David's Hall. He bases the evening around a light-hearted telling of his life story, from his beginnings in Carmarthenshire to a career on the opera stages of the world, and now TV and radio fame. He punctuates his tale with comedy routines and a selection of songs that soundtrack his journey and illustrate his love of music. He is joined by his brother and fellow singer Mark, plus West End star Sophie Evans.

programme.title: Dionne Warwick - Don't Make Me Over
programme.desc: Profile of the singer whose career has spanned more than four decades with hits such as Alfie, Walk On By and That's What Friends Are For. Featuring contributions from friends, family and collaborators including Burt Bacharach, Tom Jones, Gloria Estefan, Quincy Jones and Michael Caine.

programme.title: Dionne Warwick at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances on BBC programmes by the singer, featuring Heartbreaker, Always Something There to Remind Me, Anyone Who Had a Heart, All the Love in the World, and That's What Friends Are For with Elton John.

programme.title: The Human Voice (2020)
programme.desc: A woman waiting for her ex-lover to collect his suitcases from her flat gets one last chance to speak to him over the phone, while the couple's dog watches, unable to comprehend that his master has abandoned them. Pedro Almodóvar's short film based on Jean Cocteau's play, starring Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Crisis pregnancy advice centres are supposed to help women with unplanned pregnancies, but an investigation reveals evidence that some clinics, operating outside the NHS, are giving misleading information and offering counselling that could persuade women not to have abortions. Reporter Divya Talwar also uncovers links between some UK centres and the anti-abortion movement in America.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Copies of a pornographic pamphlet circulate Versailles depicting Chartres as the Queen's lover and father to the unborn child, cuckolding the King. Louis locks down the château, and Antoinette's many enemies are questioned. Yolande vies against Lamballe to be closest to the troubled ruler.

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Fearing an outbreak of scurvy, the crew stops in St Augustine, where the search for citrus leads to a run-in with a major figure from Jim's past. Meanwhile, after learning that Blackbeard is ready to move on to his next adventure, Stede forces his pirate friend and Lucius on a treasure hunt. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Rhys Darby.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place.

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place.

programme.title: Live: James Whale
programme.desc: The baby-boomer with a booming voice. Expect bold opinions and bald-headed commentary, as James Whale reacts to the big stories of the day.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: In Montana's Glacier National Park, some claim that there is a hidden underground Nazi base that may even have been the final hideout for Hitler himself.

programme.title: National Park Mysteries
programme.desc: From inexplicable disappearances to mysterious experiments, events in Mount Shasta National Park may be explained by an ancient Karuk Indian legend.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge chases down defendants attempting an escape. Another criminal brandishes an unlikely weapon in the courtroom.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A judge gets a mouthful from a foul-mouthed defendant. A man accused of murder slashes his own throat in court, and another is defended by a member of the family he is suing.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Before Dusty returns to Florida, he's determined to help Jacob bag a behemoth that's been eating other 'gators. Frenchy and Gee hunt for the beast that's been stealing all of their bait, while Troy and Terral ruthlessly pursue the deadly giant that killed their neighbour's dog. Willie takes on a 900lb monster that's been taking bites out of his catches.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public at Tatton Park in Cheshire sort the treasures from their trash. Dealer Stuart Hofgartner is amazed when an antique safe is brought into the saleroom, and Brenda Haller adds to a seller's anniversary fund.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: All the buyers get burned on the hottest auction day of the year, as temperatures and tempers reach boiling point.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things heat up at the shop when a seller brings in a trophy awarded to a basketball legend. Will it be a slam dunk or an air ball?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff check out some vintage horse equipment. Will Corey say yay or neigh to the McClellan Saddle?.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Strangest Things
programme.sub-title: The Viking Coin, the Ancient Disk and the Dead Girl That Saved Millions
programme.desc: A look at one of the most famous Viking coins ever discovered, and a death mask of a girl who drowned in Paris.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Cameras witness the damage as a tsunami crashes into the coast of Chile, and a man who almost drowns as he attempts to save a teenager from the sea.

programme.title: Storm Stories
programme.desc: In May 1998, the historic town of Sarno in southern Italy was ravaged by rain. Eventually the rain-saturated mountain slopes gave way, with torrents of mud travelling at up to 60 kilometres per hour burying dozens of people. Survivors describe the extreme weather conditions that resulted in the deaths of 161 people.

programme.title: Storm Stories
programme.desc: Chronicling the events of August 16, 2004, when the village of Boscastle in Cornwall was hit by a deluge of torrential rain that overwhelmed the entire community.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his tow brothers discuss some of their toughest adventures over the years, while Al, Ken, Jason and Mitch share tales and advice with each other.

programme.title: Rust Valley Restorers
programme.desc: A crew of car lovers at a garage in the Rocky Mountains transforms abandoned heaps of rust into collectible classics. Mike Hall puts his all into the construction of a '71 Camaro to honour a friend battling cancer.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller comes into the shop with an explosive pair of crutches. Then, Rick takes a swing at one of the first books written about baseball..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chum pay a visit to a classic car showroom to see a Shelby featured in series one. A seller arrives with a classic Nintendo video game, Chum gets his hands on an autographed Olympic snowboard, while a military veteran brings in a pair of Second World War binoculars.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists explore the idea that meteorites could be pieces of extraterrestrial technology.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Antarctica may serve as home base for extraterrestrial visitors to Earth, but as human exploration of the frozen continent increases, humans may come face to face with the ruins of an ancient advanced civilization buried beneath the ice. This episode explores the icy wilderness to find out whether the claims are true.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Satellite images have revealed a giant face that appears to be carved into the Earth in Alberta, Canada, which has now become known as 'The Badlands Guardian'.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Physicist Bob Lazar, who says he was hired to reverse-engineer an alien spacecraft by the US government, with a fuel source that had the power to change the world.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout history, there have been stories of strange beings unlike anything known to exist on Earth. Could they be more than just mythology and if so, did they come to shape mankind's past - or its future?.

programme.title: Eating History
programme.desc: Vintage food expert Old Smokey and collector Josh Macuga travel to the final frontier for some spacey spuds. Then, they cook up some revolutionary rice.

programme.title: Eating History
programme.desc: Something's fishy when vintage food expert Old Smokey and collector Josh Macuga 'slap test' water rations from 1953. Then, the duo experience some classic Italian canned food and visit an infamous Irish bar.

programme.title: Believers: Extreme Hauntings
programme.desc: A Hollywood photographer is attacked by the spirit of an angry sailor, a security guard discovers a ghost's presence on CCTV, and a police detective is shocked to discover that a missing woman seen by a passer by is actually dead.

programme.title: I Am a Killer
programme.desc: In 1990, 19-year-old Robert Shafer and 16-year-old David Steinmeyer handed themselves into police in St Charles, Missouri, confessing to the killings of two men - Dennis Young and Jerry Parker. Here, Shafer tells his macabre story from behind bars.

programme.title: Homicide: Hours to Kill
programme.desc: When a student is stabbed more than 100 times, detectives have to hatch a plan to get a DNA sample from a cunning and uncooperative sociopath.

When his failure to dissuade the queen from attending fail, he sends inept officers Duff and Blathers to the museum to keep watch overnight.

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: The school three-legged fun run is staged, and Lilly is enraged when easy-going Rob agrees to partner her without an argument. Lily tells Cassie and Maxwell about Rob's inability to get angry and they decide to cure him.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: With their juice bar empty, a grandma and granddaughter ask the Ninjas for a mariachi band to entice customers - but Konpeki’s trumpet playing threatens the delivery..

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: A school girl orders a wish-granting vase so she doesn't have to go to school, but the Ninjas must face a series of tests set by the vase's guardian in order to get it..

When his failure to dissuade the queen from attending fail, he sends inept officers Duff and Blathers to the museum to keep watch overnight.

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: The school three-legged fun run is staged, and Lilly is enraged when easy-going Rob agrees to partner her without an argument. Lily tells Cassie and Maxwell about Rob's inability to get angry and they decide to cure him.

programme.title: Ninja Express

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: With their juice bar empty, a grandma and granddaughter ask the Ninjas for a mariachi band to entice customers - but Konpeki’s trumpet playing threatens the delivery..

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: A school girl orders a wish-granting vase so she doesn't have to go to school, but the Ninjas must face a series of tests set by the vase's guardian in order to get it..

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.sub-title: The Other Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: When the Baron stops the earth from spinning with a plague of traffic lights, only Danger Mouse and Penfold can save the world with a hotwired satellite and a moon-sized image of the Baron's green face.

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.title: Pokemon

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny faces three target challenges, but will he succeed and avoid a gunge-filled forfeit?.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An accident at an asteroid-based mining facility sends the rock hurtling toward the Sun, with crewman Ned Tedford still on-site. Alan and Kayo deploy Thunderbird Three for the rescue mission, but when a rogue solar flare knocks out their sensors, they are forced to find a way to alter the asteroid's trajectory so that it loops around the sun instead of plummeting to its ultra-hot surface. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rasmus Hardiker and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy challenges MK to deliver an order in an allotted time to the Monkey King, so MK goes through obstacles that challenge his focus in order to accomplish his goal..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Demon Bull King's family has found a mysterious power source that will allow them to reclaim their former glory, but it's locked behind an ancient gate. The key to it, which can open any door, was given to MK as thanks for saving the city over and over - after messing around with the key, Red Son finds them. A game of cat and mouse ensues as DBK's family tries to get the key and MK and Mei attempt to keep it away..

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is fed up with being chosen all the time - every time a student is summoned to the blackboard or asked to perform a chore, he's the one picked out! When Mr Brick plans to choose someone to be John-Cedrick's partner for the I Love My School civic project, Mo decides to use the Spectral Spectre to avoid that fate. He wants to become invisible, but when his best friend Lenny gets chosen instead, Mo will have to get his friend out of this terrible situation..

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Ever since they found out that Hollywood film star Timothy Bloom is JC's cousin, JC's 'courtiers' follow him around the school. Sam and Stella are shocked at his abuse of power, but Mo doesn't really care... that is, until he is forbidden from entering the school bathroom as it is now exclusively used as JC's headquarters. This is the last straw - determined to eliminate JC's 'royal court', Mo asks the Sceptre for the power to turn whoever he wants into his own courtier..

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. He's so strong, so buff, and he's got so many super-cool tattoos - there's no-one like Jason Tattoo! The star of our heroes' favourite action films has the most awesome tattoos... so they think 'What a good idea!' The friends totally need tattoos to be fly, but it's not so easy to get one when you're ten years old, though!.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe reveals her list of the funniest boys she knows, but what a disappointment it turns out to be for our heroes - they're not even mentioned! The trio, who consider themselves to be super hilarious, try to convince Zoe of their comic potential, and they even ask for tips from the funniest man in town, who just so happens to be Pedro's grandpa!.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. PJ, Issa and Pedro can't believe their eyes when they find out that the newest hip accessory is a crocodile tooth - being hip is expensive, though, and our pals don't have the cash they need, especially since Issa is saving up to buy a collectible action figure! Simone offers them a space at her booth at the neighbourhood flea market, but what should they do with the money that they earn from it?.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. When Issa's grandpa tells him that three guys instantly became the coolest people on the planet by going to the Moon in 1969, the three friends love the idea and decide to do the same! It's not easy, though, and they realise quite quickly that they don't know a lot about rocket science, but even if they can't really go to the Moon, nothing's stopping them from making a video that says that they did....

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. A talent show is being organised in the neighbourhood, and one of the members of the jury is none other than the idol of our three heroes - it's the rapper MC Posey! It's a golden opportunity to get a selfie with the star, and they'll have bragging rights for ages - the friends therefore decide to participate in the event, even if their musical talents are less than extraordinary....

programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his friends and family. Ted's keen to make a big impression on his first day of high school, believing he's done just that when he completes an initiation on the school bus by mooning a nearby car, but there's a problem - the driver of the car is deputy head Mr Rodman! Ted, Jai and Cody must now break into that same car to retrieve the incriminating evidence from the dash cam - meanwhile, Jada is busy trying to join an exclusive study group..

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his friends and family. Ted's desperate to sample the school chocolate cake, and after realising that the choir are always first to get it, he hatches the perfect plan - he, Jai, and Cody will simply join the choir themselves. Only Cody makes it through, however, and fearing he may have lost Cody to a cult, Ted has to dig deep to get his friend back - meanwhile, Jada loses her place on the basketball team in favour of her clumsy friend Leah..

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten

programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Ted feigns illness to fool Lani and buy himself more time to complete the project, while Stu is genuinely sick and not helped by the fact that Bodhi secretly brings a dog home who proceeds to torment him in his fevered state..

programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Marge suffers a nervous breakdown and has to be packed off for a well-earned rest, leaving Lisa and Bart with Patty and Selma, and Homer alone with Maggie.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart, Milhouse, Nelson and Ralph are 'discovered' by record producer LT Smash and recruited as singers in a boy band, but Lisa begins to suspect the mogul's motives may not be entirely above board. Featuring the guest voices of 'N Sync.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer uncovers a plan to move his beloved Springfield Isotopes baseball team to New Mexico, so he takes desperate measures to keep them in town and goes on hunger strike in protest. With the guest voice of Stacy Keach.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to make friends with a new girl at school who turns out to be a terrible bully - prompting her to look for a remedy for antisocial behaviour. Meanwhile, Homer gets into the child safety business.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer, Marge and the kids hitch a ride on a train, where they are entertained by a tramp who tells them a series of colourful yarns based on American folklore - all of which feature characters suspiciously reminiscent of Homer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is the Old Rose & Crown in Lickey, Birmingham, where guests have some problems with the paintwork and are missing fresh milk.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Middlewick in Glastonbury, Somerset, run by Jill Barker and Inez Findlay, who hope their famously mystical location will enchant their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Griffin Inn, in Irnham, Lincolnshire, where hosts Jamie and Leila Benton Jones invite the B&Bers to their very own village, steeped in history.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Crossroads House owned by Julie and Alistair Musgrave, who pride themselves on their full English fry-up and Cumberland banger. Jamie and Leila are surprised by the B&B's roadside location but impressed by their newly spick-and-span room, while Jill and Inez dig into the mismatched decor in theirs. At drinks, Julie and Alistair reveal their entrepreneurial ambitions and are confident their breakfast offering will bring home the win. In the morning, Jamie and Leila are feeling rough after a restless night whilst in the kitchen Julie is experiencing a last-minute crisis of confidence.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to trade feedback, starting with The Old Rose & Crown, where Jamie and Leila lay into the linen. The B&Bers discuss lukewarm reactions to the facilities, problems with paying for breakfast and picky comments about the paintwork. Things take an emotional turn when Julie and Alistair chew over their bad breakfast score. There are harsh truths, heated debates and disagreements as the payments are revealed before the winner is finally announced.

programme.title: The Karate Kid (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager at a new school befriends a pretty girl, but her ex-boyfriend is jealous and attacks him. During one particularly bad fight, a wise old caretaker intervenes and defeats the youngster's assailants using his martial arts skills. He goes on to mentor the boy and teach him karate so he can face his enemies in a tournament. Drama, with Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita and Elisabeth Shue.

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château du Doux in the Dordogne region, bad weather threatens to derail Abbie, Clive and Karen's first wedding of the year. Elsewhere, in the Loire Valley, Ben and Billie near the end of the renovation of their two guest apartments. Ben has his work cut out to put up a chandelier with no lighting fixture, while Billie attempts to paint new life into old furniture.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lou and Tony dream of buying their own Spanish holiday home to enjoy with all their family. They're looking for a house with great views and lots of outdoor space for Tony to exercise his green fingers on the Canary island of Tenerife. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their budget of £350,000

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany arrives by boat in Bodrum, Turkey, and gains unprecedented access to the recently unearthed tomb of the leader of a remarkable dynasty from the 4th century BCE. At Patara, she finds a building with connections to the American constitution and finds the city to be the hometown of St Nicholas, also known as Father Christmas. She also investigates exciting new developments at the world-famous site of Troy where she reveals the truth behind the tales of the Trojan War.

programme.title: Living Wild: How to Change Your Life
programme.desc: Sophie Morgan heads to the Isles of Scilly to meet a couple who quit their London lives for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to run the general store on the idyllic Bryher. She also meets Marion, who has finally been able to turn a life-long passion for art into a career by moving onto a narrowboat on the Kennet and Avon canal.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the battle for pole in the opening round of the season, held at Bahrain International Circuit in Sakhir. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc qualified fastest here last year, with eventual champion Max Verstappen of Red Bull joining him at the front of the grid. With analysis from David Coulthard and Mark Webber.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner.

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host.

programme.title: Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver shows how to make good food quickly with Singapore-style fried rice and shares a method for egg-free gnocchi, as well as an easy harissa chicken tray bake.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide prospective buyers through the complex world of viewings and agents as they try to buy a home.

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Chef Tony Singh and presenter Sophie Morgan compete to make the best holiday snow globes, and TV personality Mark-Francis Vandelli goes head to head with queen of clean Aggie MacKenzie to make intricate jelly art.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jacinta and Marco, who have outgrown their home in Didsbury, Greater Manchester, while Phil Spencer assists newly engaged Olivia and Amy, who want to settle back in the North after five years on the move.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge visits the doctor, convinced she is pregnant again, leaving Homer behind to reminisce about the ups and downs of their life together since their marriage at Shotgun Pete's all-night wedding chapel.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart uses a radio transmitter to trick the townsfolk of Springfield into thinking a child has fallen down a disused well. As events get out of hand, he is forced to own up and face the music - but has difficulty making amends. Featuring the guest voice of Sting.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa begins to feel increasingly neglected by Homer and tries to worm her way into his affections by feigning an interest in American football. Amazingly, she soon shows an aptitude for predicting the outcome of games - an ability that sets him off on an amazing but ill-fated run of betting success.

programme.title: ABBA's Greatest Hits
programme.desc: A countdown of the Swedish group's best-selling singles, from Dancing Queen to Thank You for the Music, 30 years after they wowed Eurovision audiences with Waterloo. With contributions from singers Elvis Costello and Dannii Minogue, tennis player Greg Rusedski, fashion designer Wayne Hemingway and Andy Bell of Erasure, who released an Abba medley in 1992.

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Swindon control springs into action when an unexploded Second World War bomb is found near the line in Teignmouth, transport police seek a word with a man who jumped onto the track to retrieve something he dropped, and team leader Martyn reveals the high cost of cleaning up graffiti.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A look at how the festive period affects regular operations at the station, with staff calling in the help of some reindeer and a white owl to get passengers in the mood of the season. Up the line, engineers are working on one of the most important projects of this year's Christmas works - laying a whole new track system outside Oxford Station. Although there is no regular train service at Paddington, staff still need to be on duty on Christmas Day, but they take advantage of the lack of customers by having a rare sit-down lunch together.

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski investigates places of worship designed by Christopher Wren after the Great Fire of London in 1666. Assigned to rebuild 51 of the city's churches, he created a trademark open, auditorium-style feel to emphasise the shift from Catholic to Anglican dominance.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian interior designer and estate agent Ann Maurice visits a house on the market, and offers advice on making it more attractive to would-be buyers.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Interior design guru Ann Maurice creates the illusion of space in a 200-year-old cottage in the Cotswold village of Hawkesbury Upton. She also persuades the owner to move her pet ferrets from the yard to an adjacent barn so they do not deter possible buyers.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa visit Granny and Grandpa Pig, who are very excited about their new parrot.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Sarah and James accidentally cause a fire at the water tower while decorating the new station, it is Jupiter that saves the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa get caught outside in the middle of a big thunderstorm.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone pitches in to help wash Daddy Pig's car before going for a drive in the country.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The friends help Jamila make a room for the ants in her bug hotel.

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly goes on a camping trip with Ben and his parents, but the annoying Mr Gnome turns up.

programme.title: Shane the Chef
programme.desc: Sid Singh takes the children on a nature trip, but when Mario spooks the ponies and they trample Maggie's butternut squash patch, Shane comes to the rescue.

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.desc: A group of builders get to work fixing the railway lines all over Toyland - only to discover that all their tools have gone missing.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom and Moose volunteer to help Mandy and Norman spot a fox, the animal scampers off with Moose's hat.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Samson accidentally takes Gordon's express coaches to the quarry instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Posy accidentally forgets that she already promised to play with Frankie in the sandpit before makes a commitment to play with Pip as well, so she struggles to keep up her energy after decides to try playing with both of them at the same time.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is excited to learn that Mummy Rabbit is pregnant.

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Dino Rescue: Pups Save a Hum-Dino

programme.desc: Tomas accidentally turns Abuelo into a chicken.

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington
programme.desc: The bear rescues Pancake Day after Mrs Bird hurts her arms snowboarding and is unable to do any cooking.

programme.title: Pop Paper City
programme.desc: Hooper plans a beach day for his friends, but Phoebe is worried that he might need help, so she tries to organise the day for him.

programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves to dinner at the castle, where they sample Nanny Plum's cooking.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe claims she kissed Ralph Lauren at Rachel's workplace, and room-mate Janine encourages Joey to get in touch with his feminine side, much to Chandler's annoyance. Ross bleaches his teeth in an effort to impress a date. Comedy, guest starring Elle Macpherson.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Got High
programme.desc: Monica's parents arrive for Thanksgiving, leading to trouble for Chandler, who discovers they don't like him because they think he uses drugs. Fortunately, their disapproval soon focuses on Ross instead. Comedy, guest starring Elliott Gould and Christina Pickles.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey tries to find the perfect opportunity to kiss Janine, while Ross and Monica resurrect their high-school dance routine for a TV programme. Comedy, guest starring Elle Macpherson.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Apothecary Table
programme.desc: Joey finally dates Janine, but she does not like his friends. Rachel worries that Phoebe will not appreciate the way she has furnished their apartment owing to her 'environmental conscience'. Comedy, guest starring Elle Macpherson.

programme.title: Clueless (1995)
programme.desc: A rich high-school student uses all her charm and financial clout to boost an awkward new pupil's image, but soon finds she has created a monster - while her own popularity suffers in the process. Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: Clueless (1995)
programme.desc: A rich high-school student uses all her charm and financial clout to boost an awkward new pupil's image, but soon finds she has created a monster - while her own popularity suffers in the process. Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: The First Wives Club (1996)
programme.desc: Three former college friends reunite at the funeral of a mutual acquaintance, who killed herself after her husband left her for a younger woman. Finding themselves in a similar situation, the trio decide to take action and hit their former partners where it hurts most - their finances. Comedy, starring Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton, Maggie Smith, Dan Hedaya, Bronson Pinchot and Elizabeth Berkley.

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.

programme.title: The First Wives Club (1996)
programme.desc: Three former college friends reunite at the funeral of a mutual acquaintance, who killed herself after her husband left her for a younger woman. Finding themselves in a similar situation, the trio decide to take action and hit their former partners where it hurts most - their finances. Comedy, starring Goldie Hawn, Bette Midler, Diane Keaton, Maggie Smith, Dan Hedaya, Bronson Pinchot and Elizabeth Berkley.

programme.title: Elizabeth & Margaret: Service and Sacrifice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between Queen Elizabeth II and her younger sister, revealing how Princess Margaret sacrificed her own happiness for her sibling and the monarchy. The programme explores how Margaret shaped the Queen in unexpected ways, from the early years when they were the perfect royal pair, to the 1960s when it was Margaret who stole the show, through the scandals and backlash of the 1970s.

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.

programme.title: The Middletons: Model Royal In-Laws
programme.desc: Exploring what really happened when the Princess of Wales' family met the royals, looking at how they coped with the rules, the potential gaffes and navigating within the monarchy.

programme.title: Harry Wild
programme.desc: Harry and Fergus are approached by a woman desperate to find out how her husband died and although they are reluctant to get involved, their interest is soon piqued. They discover gamblers are running a snuff game in Dublin and Harry turns over the evidence they uncover to Charlie, vowing to stay out of it, but the killers have other ideas.

programme.title: Jimmy Tarbuck: 60 Years of Laughs
programme.desc: At the age of 80, Jimmy Tarbuck tells the story of his extraordinary career. Over three months he has recorded all the anecdotes from a lifetime in the limelight. With contributions from family, friends and stars, such as Bradley Walsh, Michael Parkinson, Cliff Richard, Les Dennis and, in their last interview together, Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre: Funny Man
programme.desc: An affectionate look back at the comedian's life and career in a documentary charting his early struggles to launch his showbusiness career through to hosting the Royal Variety Performance and his arena-filling tours. Contributors include McIntyre himself, alongside Jonathan Ross, Eamonn Holmes, Marcus Brigstocke, Rob Rinder, Kate Copstick and Andi Osho.

programme.title: Eurovision: Secrets & Scandals
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering what goes on behind the scenes at the Eurovision song contest, revealing untold stories of political chicanery, fake participants and voting scandals and featuring contributions from former participants, industry insiders and Eurovision historians.

programme.title: ABBA's Greatest Hits
programme.desc: A countdown of the Swedish group's best-selling singles, from Dancing Queen to Thank You for the Music, 30 years after they wowed Eurovision audiences with Waterloo. With contributions from singers Elvis Costello and Dannii Minogue, tennis player Greg Rusedski, fashion designer Wayne Hemingway and Andy Bell of Erasure, who released an Abba medley in 1992.

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Swindon control springs into action when an unexploded Second World War bomb is found near the line in Teignmouth, transport police seek a word with a man who jumped onto the track to retrieve something he dropped, and team leader Martyn reveals the high cost of cleaning up graffiti.

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A look at how the festive period affects regular operations at the station, with staff calling in the help of some reindeer and a white owl to get passengers in the mood of the season. Up the line, engineers are working on one of the most important projects of this year's Christmas works - laying a whole new track system outside Oxford Station. Although there is no regular train service at Paddington, staff still need to be on duty on Christmas Day, but they take advantage of the lack of customers by having a rare sit-down lunch together.

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski investigates places of worship designed by Christopher Wren after the Great Fire of London in 1666. Assigned to rebuild 51 of the city's churches, he created a trademark open, auditorium-style feel to emphasise the shift from Catholic to Anglican dominance.

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski investigates places of worship designed by Christopher Wren after the Great Fire of London in 1666. Assigned to rebuild 51 of the city's churches, he created a trademark open, auditorium-style feel to emphasise the shift from Catholic to Anglican dominance.

programme.title: House Doctor

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys make off with a bulging bounty of cool signs when they pick an old train caboose in the Californian mountains.

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?

programme.sub-title: My Deadly Face Tumour: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man with a facial tumour needs one more operation, but may not be able to face the procedure after a near-death experience.

programme.title: Monsters Inside Me
programme.desc: A parasite eats the leg of a teenage boy, while another infects a couple, placing an immense strain on their lives. Plus, worms find their way into an eight year-old girl's eyeball.

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Tensions grow between Robin and Josh as they try to move an important jade slab. Plus, Scrappy Larry hopes to secure a bargain deal from an old friend..

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: The crew must navigate a treacherous road to safely deliver a valuable jade slab. Mechanical problems and torrential rain cause them big problems..

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: As the Fox Cabin nears completion, Atz Sr unites seven Kilcher siblings to finish the interior of his legacy rebuild. Eivin suffers a devastating loss.

programme.desc: Stonemason Shannon teams up with firefighter Tim to tackle the extreme heat tumultuous rainstorms and bubbling mud volcanoes of Trinidad's tropical rainforests.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites Aisling Bea, Corey Taylor and Ross Noble and Alan Davies to answer questions on subjects associated with nosey and noisy in an extended edition of the comedy panel game. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Jon and Lucy agree to hamster-sit for the neighbours, Jon tries out new stand-up material, and Lucy uses a corporate gig as a chance to stage a protest against the fossil fuel industry.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glenn Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman reveals who is the week's winner.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Guest host Stephen Mangan is joined by Ross Noble and Ria Lina on an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Montreal, Canada where replicas of a DeLorean and the Ghostbusters' Ecto-1 are among the vehicles taking part in the downhill race.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As auctioneer Sean Kelly and the team arrive in Gwent, Heavy D confuses the other bidders and himself. Meanwhile, Nat takes a gamble, but John is far from happy.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Leeds.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Certified 'indoorsman' Phil Wang convinces best friend Pierre Novellie - also not much better at outdoor stuff - to join him in Lesotho, Africa's Kingdom in the Sky.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister comes down with a mutated strain of pneumonia that makes his feverish hallucinations come to life. Some of them turn out to be very tricky customers indeed, and wage a war over control of the patient's mind. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Craig Ferguson.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and the Cat are horrified when Rimmer duplicates himself, but their shock turns to hilarity when the identically petty pair move in together, only to find they are not very well matched. Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules star.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenters Dale Winton and Richard Bacon, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes comic actress Miranda Hart and sports presenter Clare Balding. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by comedian Rhod Gilbert and actress Sally Phillips, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes TV presenters Des O'Connor and Tess Daly. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from former EastEndersAnnette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Tom Allen, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Thanyia Moore. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the panel show, and invites Jason Manford, Sara Pascoe, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of 'noble rot'. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.
