programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. But when he suddenly can't remember the name of the leading actor and his hypochondria tells him he is losing his memory, Lucy's evening is completely ruined.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenters Dale Winton and Richard Bacon, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes comic actress Miranda Hart and sports presenter Clare Balding. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by comedian Rhod Gilbert and actress Sally Phillips, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes TV presenters Des O'Connor and Tess Daly. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from former EastEndersAnnette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts as regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on the latest events in news and politics, with the help of Tom Allen, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Thanyia Moore. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on one another.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Life on G Wing looks set to take an unexpected glamorous turn when a footballer's ex-wife arrives at Larkhall. Governor Neil Grayling vows to find out why all his officers' drug tests have come back positive for heroin. Selena heads for Canada in a last-ditch attempt to persuade Milly to clear Kris's name, and virtually all the inmates fall victim to a mysterious illness. First of three special crossover episodes with Footballers' Wives, guest starring Zoe Lucker.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A bewildered Dom throws himself into work as he struggles to process a shocking family secret. However, being around Ange proves difficult, causing Dom to make a drastic decision about his career. Zosia publicly undermines Jac's authority, putting a strain on their already-fraught relationship, and Donna's parenting is called into question.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: After Alex Grant's death, it emerges his daughter Rachel has been incarcerated in an asylum for 30 years for having an illegitimate child. Janet is determined to secure her release, but Dr Cameron doubts the wisdom of her efforts. Drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The renovation of Arden House gets under way, but Dr Finlay begins to wonder if it was such a good idea when Dr Neil becomes increasingly vexed. Meanwhile, Janet grapples with her own problems and Dr Cameron's night-time call-out is tinged with tragedy. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic resolves to track down a mysterious man who callously ignored his request to call for an ambulance - and Finlay's obsession soon leads him into a macabre world. Drama, starring David Rintoul.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels increasingly isolated as the day of Janet and Angus's wedding approaches and Dr Finlay is drawn toward the new National Health Service. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a German mayor visits Great Slaughter to partake in a war memorial ceremony, tragedy strikes; Sister Boniface investigates whether it's a accident or a malicious plan.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The preliminary rounds of Miss United Britain are well underway, but the beauty queens get a gruesome wakeup call when Miss Northern Ireland is found drowned.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy Irishwoman descends on the restaurant with her new husband in tow who turns out to be a figure from Margaret's wild past in swinging 1960s London. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Nigel Terry.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a spate of garden thefts, focusing his inquiries on a horticultural landscaper whose business has blossomed since the robberies began. Unfortunately, his initial stake-out proves a disaster and, to top it all, Margaret hires the chief suspect to redesign the plot behind the restaurant. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: In the summer of 1966, the Northumbrian police come under increasing media scrutiny as Sunderland prepares to host a World Cup match involving the USSR, while campaigners protest against the proposed landing of the Polaris nuclear submarine at Jarrow docks. When an academic is found dead after a CND rally, Gently and Bacchus are dispatched to Durham University to investigate his background - and find themselves in the middle of a wave of social and sexual rebellion. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Sarah Lancashire and Warren Clarke.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.sub-title: From the Cradle to the Grave
programme.desc: Chaos ensues when a museum's Egyptian mummy case turns out to contain the body of a very recently deceased woman.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars.

programme.title: Mrs Wilson
programme.desc: After the sudden death of novelist and Secret Intelligence Service worker Alexander Wilson, wife Alison is forced to investigate when mysteries from her late husband's past come knocking. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson, Iain Glen and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Colin turns violent when he discovers his brother is being bullied by one of the nurses at his care home. However, he gets in trouble with the police when the man he attacked ends up in a coma.

Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Sarah Lancashire and Warren Clarke.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. After nine months of being single, 23-year-old university graduate Sapphire from Kent has decided to see if she can find her ideal woman by stripping back the layers. Thirty-two-year-old account manager Kieron from Basingstoke has spent the past three years single to focus on his career, but now he's ready to put finding a partner at the top of his to do list. Anna Richardson hosts.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from October 2020 including This Morning, The Million Pound Cube, Strictly Come Dancing, The Undoing, The Yorkshire Vet and First Dates, plus BBC reports on the US election and the Welsh shopping ban.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An international DJ who has learned some new things about her sexuality after a recent holiday to Ibiza now has to get to grips with London's same-sex dating scene - which is not easy when her first date is someone she previously blanked on a dating app. A man with deteriorating vision and a desire to start a family is paired with a trombone player, while other candidates include a full-time carer and a medical student looking to date outside her profession.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Rosaria bought Bella Luna to realise her son Gianfranco's ambition to become a chef, but the Italian restaurant's future looks bleak due to his lack of experience in the kitchen combined with her refusal to acknowledge the eatery's many flaws. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly decides their street needs another stop sign and pleads her case to the city comptroller. Barry panics when he realises he's neglected his college applications, while Erica struggles with her career choice.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and his friends are recruited to the William Penn Academy baseball team. Barry remains in denial about his pitching skills, while Geoff's father interferes in his relationship with Erica.

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost comes to the rescue of Upstate New York couple Ian and Jamie Orr, whose children's problems range from picky eating to playing violent video games that lead to nightmares.

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The teams must create wind-powered builds, with Caleb and Alex deciding to create a wizard casting a spell, while Joss and Henry put together a moving caterpillar.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?.

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay discovers Gloria has planned a romantic getaway to Hawaii for his birthday, but his excitement fades when he realises the rest of the clan will be joining them. Starring Ed O'Neill and Sofia Vergara.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to be romantic when the family goes on holiday to Hawaii, and Jay realises it will not be as relaxing as he had hoped. Elsewhere, Mitch and Cam cannot decide whether to go sightseeing, and the children run riot. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire's plans for a family portrait do not go smoothly, and Cameron reveals his inner diva. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Eric Stonestreet.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finally gets Phil to agree to sell their old car, Mitchell decides to build a large princess castle for Lily, and Manny invites a girl over for a study date - which makes Gloria uncomfortable. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finds herself becoming an overbearing mother when she finds out that Alex has a crush on a boy, and Haley's idea of sisterly advice is not helping matters. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron have an argument over the former's aversion to public displays of affection, and Gloria believes that her grandmother has been visiting in her dreams. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill.

programme.title: Playing with Fire (2019)
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friend's sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newark) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces critiques shows including The Masked Dancer, Dirty Dancing, Best of Top Gear, Naked Attraction, Tom Allen's Quizness, Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back, and The Bad Skin Clinic. Participants include Nick Grimshaw, Denise van Outen, Mo Gilligan, Shaun Ryder, Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, Gyles Brandreth, Maureen Lipman, Iain Stirling, Laura Whitmore, Lorraine Kelly, Tom Jones, Anne-Marie, Jamie Carragher and Clara Amfo.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Traitors, Gino's Cooking up Love, Lady Chatterley's Lover, I Can See Your Voice, Blowing LA, This Morning and White Christmas.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including It's a Sin, Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, Married at First Sight Australia, Snakes in the City, Surviving Death, This Morning and Gordon Ramsay's Bank Balance. Plus, BBC news coverage of Boris Johnson's road map announcement concerning reducing the restrictions of lockdown.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales adviser Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. Anna Richardson hosts.

programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon re-evaluates the time he spends with Amy when she takes a job at the university. Meanwhile, Howard is forced to sleep on his friend's sofa after he gets into an argument with Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Mayim Bialik.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newark) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981)
programme.desc: Intrepid archaeologist Indiana Jones goes in search of the legendary Ark of the Covenant, a biblical artefact of devastating power. His quest leads him to Egypt, where the Nazis are plotting to use the Ark to further Hitler's plans for world domination - aided by Jones's deceitful French rival. The first of five big-screen action adventures, starring Harrison Ford as Indy, with Karen Allen, Paul Freeman and John Rhys-Davies.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces critiques shows including The Masked Dancer, Dirty Dancing, Best of Top Gear, Naked Attraction, Tom Allen's Quizness, Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back, and The Bad Skin Clinic. Participants include Nick Grimshaw, Denise van Outen, Mo Gilligan, Shaun Ryder, Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, Gyles Brandreth, Maureen Lipman, Iain Stirling, Laura Whitmore, Lorraine Kelly, Tom Jones, Anne-Marie, Jamie Carragher and Clara Amfo.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Traitors, Gino's Cooking up Love, Lady Chatterley's Lover, I Can See Your Voice, Blowing LA, This Morning and White Christmas.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer return for more consensual indignity at the hands of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Jonny wants to split up with his girlfriend - and boss - Liz, but is too scared to do so, while Adam is happy to keep teasing him about her age. Meanwhile, Dad has been drying fish under the stairs and Grandma somehow manages to get locked in the boot of Adam's car when she comes round for dinner. Comedy, starring Tom Rosenthal.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: The boys come home to find the builders have been in and the house is in a complete mess. On top of this, there's a mouse loose and Mum takes refuge in the shed, leaving Dad in charge of making dinner. Jim pops round to see if he can help, and is invited for his first-ever Friday night dinner with the Goodmans. Comedy, with Mark Heap.

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a countdown of 50 viral clips of merry mishaps, including a parallel parking fail marathon, the infamous Wealdstone Raider, a scary ice-cream van and a memorable TV news debut.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: Only the Biggest Hits
programme.desc: Turn up the volume on your TV! We're about to play only the biggest hits from some of your favourite music stars!.

programme.title: The Big Monthly Round Up
programme.desc: Entertainment guru Lucy Jones rounds up the biggest music, telly and pop culture gossip of the month. With a massive pop playlist to match.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior: Japan
programme.desc: Contestants from Japan compete in one of the most demanding challenges ever created.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior: Japan
programme.desc: Contestants from Japan compete in one of the most demanding challenges ever created.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior: Japan
programme.desc: Contestants from Japan compete in one of the most demanding challenges ever created.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior: Japan
programme.desc: Contestants from Japan compete in one of the most demanding challenges ever created.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: John Cena, Nicole Byer and Camille Kostek host the show in which people from all walks of life compete over extreme obstacle courses to become the champion and win a cash prize.

programme.title: Wipeout USA
programme.desc: John Cena, Nicole Byer and Camille Kostek host the show in which people from all walks of life compete over extreme obstacle courses to become the champion and win a cash prize.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Renee Maloney, the co-founder of art class studios Painting with a Twist, goes undercover in her own organisation to make sure that her growth projections for the company are possible. She works in disguise with her own staff including an art instructor, a trainee manager and a franchise owner.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Dudan, founder and CEO of environmental services company AdvantaClean, dons a disguise to work incognito among his own staff - including a project manager, a mould-removal technician and a cleaning technician - to ensure his franchise owners are following his template for success.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm meets a chess-playing layabout who could be an older version of himself, Lois cannot understand why she is putting on weight and Francis objects to Piama posing nude in an art class - but eagerly volunteers himself when he finds out how much the job pays. Guest starring Jason Alexander (Seinfeld).

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lois goes into labour, coinciding with a less inspiring surprise in the form of a visit from Grandma Ida (Cloris Leachman). Family comedy, with Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Part two of two. Hal hurries home to be with Lois during her labour, but in his panic he crashes the car. Comedy, starring Bryan Cranston, Jane Kaczmarek, Frankie Muniz and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Hal and Lois try to organise suitable day care for the new arrival and find their best option is at a nearby church. Meanwhile, Francis takes advantage of recent reports of UFOs in the area. Christopher Kennedy Masterson, Bryan Cranston and Jane Kaczmarek star.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: The Wilkersons travel to Las Vegas, where Hal is bitten by the gambling bug and bets his life insurance policy, and Lois sees her favourite singer at a show. Guest starring David Cassidy.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Dewey makes up an incredible story to entertain the baby, and Hal goes out to buy nappies while Lois is asleep - only to find himself accused of being a shoplifter.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Stevie ends up in shock when he learns the truth about Kitty and Abe's divorce, while Dewey tries to get more attention from the family by eating baby food. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Erik Per Sullivan.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm goes off to a boozy Thanksgiving party, where he meets a good-looking girl who seems intent on flirting with him. Reese is left to prepare the dinner with Hal and Dewey roped in as his assistants, while Francis and Piama arrive at the house almost ready to divorce.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm uses Reese as the subject of his school experiment, and Francis struggles to keep his poise when he falls victim to a nasty reviewer. Dewey starts performing as a street entertainer to earn extra cash. Family comedy, starring Frankie Muniz, Justin Berfield and Christopher Masterson.

programme.title: Malcolm in the Middle
programme.desc: Malcolm discovers the awful secret Lois has been hiding, while Hal's father-and-child classes become more interesting once he starts betting on babies. Dewey runs away to be with Francis after growing tired of the rest of the family. Comedy, starring Frankie Muniz and Jane Kaczmarek.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize. Raj and Howard attempt to relive the good old days when Howard buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years earller.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is worried that people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Penny encourages Leonard to stand up for himself when he aims to become the principal investigator on a plasma physics study.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Barry Kripke finds proof that Dr Pemberton plagiarised his thesis in college, Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn their rival in or not. Howard is surprised but happy to learn that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at The Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him back in the day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is pleasantly surprised when his mother Beverly arrives and is genuinely kind to him - until he finds out the real reason for her visit. Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome at Howard and Bernadette's. Christine Baranski guest stars.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy stay up all night as they await a telephone call that could bring big news from the Nobel Committee - is everything in their lives about to change?.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the US sitcom, there's an end and a beginning as the gang travel together into an uncharted future. Howard and Bernadette go away on a trip without their children for the first time, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon helps Leonard drop off a parcel for Penny, but when he sees how messy her flat is, he tries to do a good deed - which is not well received. Johnny Gale, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. After nine months of being single, 23-year-old university graduate Sapphire from Kent has decided to see if she can find her ideal woman by stripping back the layers. Thirty-two-year-old account manager Kieron from Basingstoke has spent the past three years single to focus on his career, but now he's ready to put finding a partner at the top of his to do list. Anna Richardson hosts.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from October 2020 including This Morning, The Million Pound Cube, Strictly Come Dancing, The Undoing, The Yorkshire Vet and First Dates, plus BBC reports on the US election and the Welsh shopping ban.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An international DJ who has learned some new things about her sexuality after a recent holiday to Ibiza now has to get to grips with London's same-sex dating scene - which is not easy when her first date is someone she previously blanked on a dating app. A man with deteriorating vision and a desire to start a family is paired with a trombone player, while other candidates include a full-time carer and a medical student looking to date outside her profession.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Rosaria bought Bella Luna to realise her son Gianfranco's ambition to become a chef, but the Italian restaurant's future looks bleak due to his lack of experience in the kitchen combined with her refusal to acknowledge the eatery's many flaws. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly decides their street needs another stop sign and pleads her case to the city comptroller. Barry panics when he realises he's neglected his college applications, while Erica struggles with her career choice.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam and his friends are recruited to the William Penn Academy baseball team. Barry remains in denial about his pitching skills, while Geoff's father interferes in his relationship with Erica.

programme.title: Supernanny US
programme.desc: Jo Frost comes to the rescue of Upstate New York couple Ian and Jamie Orr, whose children's problems range from picky eating to playing violent video games that lead to nightmares.

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The teams must create wind-powered builds, with Caleb and Alex deciding to create a wizard casting a spell, while Joss and Henry put together a moving caterpillar.

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Brick Hotel in Newtown, Pennsylvania, where the staff have had enough of owner Verindar, who runs the establishment like an angry tyrant. Can Gordon convince her to value her loyal workers and entice customers back to this landmark hotel?.

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay discovers Gloria has planned a romantic getaway to Hawaii for his birthday, but his excitement fades when he realises the rest of the clan will be joining them. Starring Ed O'Neill and Sofia Vergara.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to be romantic when the family goes on holiday to Hawaii, and Jay realises it will not be as relaxing as he had hoped. Elsewhere, Mitch and Cam cannot decide whether to go sightseeing, and the children run riot. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire's plans for a family portrait do not go smoothly, and Cameron reveals his inner diva. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Eric Stonestreet.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finally gets Phil to agree to sell their old car, Mitchell decides to build a large princess castle for Lily, and Manny invites a girl over for a study date - which makes Gloria uncomfortable. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Julie Bowen and Ty Burrell.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finds herself becoming an overbearing mother when she finds out that Alex has a crush on a boy, and Haley's idea of sisterly advice is not helping matters. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron have an argument over the former's aversion to public displays of affection, and Gloria believes that her grandmother has been visiting in her dreams. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill.

programme.title: Playing with Fire (2019)
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: The Furies (2019)
programme.desc: A kidnapped woman finds herself an unwilling participant in a lethal game where women are hunted by masked men. Thriller, starring Airlie Dodds and Linda Ngo.

programme.title: 127 Hours (2010)
programme.desc: A mountain climber gets stuck in an isolated canyon when a boulder crushes his arm. Remaining trapped for five days, he comes to realise no one is going to save him, and that survival will depend on a particularly drastic course of action. Danny Boyle's fact-based drama, with James Franco and Kate Mara.

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch (1989)
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin.

programme.title: The Martian (2015)
programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. However, the astronaut has survived and faces a series of challenges - to contact Earth and arrange his rescue and to survive for the years it will take for a spacecraft to reach him on resources intended to last the crew a month. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor.

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's fact-based drama chronicles the life of Ron Kovic, an eager-to-impress, patriotic Marine Corps recruit, who endures terrifying experiences during the Vietnam conflict that leave him paralysed from the chest down. On his return home, he undergoes a harrowing journey of physical and mental recovery that leads him to question the whole purpose of the war. Starring Tom Cruise, Willem Dafoe, Kyra Sedgwick and Josh Evans.

programme.title: The Shallows (2016)
programme.desc: A surfer strays into the hunting territory of a great white shark, and finds herself stranded on a tiny island a mere 200 yards from the shore. With the deadly aquatic predator between her and the beach and her safe haven slowly disappearing as the tide comes in, she faces a life or death struggle to get safely back to dry land. Thriller, starring Blake Lively and Oscar Jaenada.

programme.title: The Furies (2019)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Host and legendary chef Guy Fieri sends four talented chefs running through the aisles in a high-stakes, high skills, grocery store cooking competition.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine heads to Pennsylvania to help the owners of a long-running eatery. Can he help them to get their restaurant back on the road to success?.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: A Baker's Life
programme.desc: The Great British Bake Off judge looks back at his early career, from being an apprentice in his dad's bakeries to working at five-star stately home Cliveden House Hotel, where he cooked for the Queen Mother. On the menu this time, are fresh fruit donuts and British-raised pork pie. Paul also returns home to Merseyside for a get-together with his oldest and closest friends and joins the nightshift at the Chester Grosvenor - the hotel where he got his big break - and bakes seasonal Danish pastries.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: A Baker's Life
programme.desc: The Great British Bake Off judge shares his favourite Mediterranean recipes on a trip to Cyprus, where he spent six years living and working. In Paphos, he's reunited with a baker friend and together they prepare a classic ham and cheese croissant, before makes baklava and a tray of celebratory spanakopita for a sunset gathering. Later, Paul recalls his first appearance on TV and bakes a Cypriot village bread using a traditional village oven.

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Eureka, California to meet a New York-pizza maker who is bringing his unique Neapolitan-style pies to northern California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels to New York's east village where a neighbourhood restaurant is serving up a standout burger.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Miami where an Asian-fusion restaurant serves up Brussels sprouts and a duck sous-vide sandwich.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits New York's lower-east side where a sibling-owned restaurant is pickling, smoking, curing and fermenting.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a selection of dishes for a casual office party, including maple bacon dip with apples, Italian cheese sticks, and crab Rangoon and fried wontons.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes an edible 'thank you' package featuring grape lemonade, old-fashioned chicken stew and a sweet lemon and raspberry cream cake.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree uses chicken in dishes including buffalo chicken burgers, Tex-Mex pulled chicken and balsamic chicken.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares shrimp scampi stuffed shells and a nacho cheese casserole, and she makes double portions so she can freeze half of it and save it for another time.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree puts a twist on classic ranch dishes, and she prepares a low-calorie courgette carbonara, spicy brussels caesar salad and chocolate brownies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond revisit some of her favourite recipes from her books. She cooks up chicken fried steak medallions, pantry pasta and butter pecan French toast.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond creates four delicious make-ahead summer treats. She makes a party-worthy blackberry crepe cake, followed by strawberry prosecco peach jellies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes fairground food, starting with bacon mac and cheese eggrolls. Next, there are classic county fair turkey legs served with a sweet and spicy barbecue sauce.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares some of Ladd's favourite foods, including spatchcock BBQ chicken, thin and crispy waffle fries and for dessert spoon cake with gooey chocolate frosting.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree fills her freezer with Tex-Mex favourites, including green chili pork stew, mac and cheese, and a veggie taco salad.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef makes a high-octane pit stop at the world-famous Sonoma Raceway. Nestled in amongst Sonoma's vineyards, James discovers the preparations for the IndyCar season finale and gets driven around the track by American motorsport hero Mario Andretti. James cooks trackside before visiting a new foodie Sonoma hotspot, simply called Shed. After a wholesome lunch made with only the best local ingredients, James gets invited to Mario's nearby vineyard for a glass of wine and to discuss the thrills and spills of motorsport.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: James enters the Los Angeles in style while driving a vintage Porsche. After a visit to an incredible food market in Santa Monica, he heads to the beach to cook up a storm. He also meets a pensioner who happens to be a fitness coach, drops in on old friend and chef-to-the-stars Wolfgang Puck at his Beverly Hills restaurant CUT and finishes his visit with a bite of his favourite pizza.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares another selection of quick meals, including crispy Camembert parcels, an autumn salad with cranberry dip and a golden chicken with braised greens and potato gratin.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a quick meal of steak Indian-style, with spinach and paneer salad, naan bread and mango dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including fish baps, mushy peas and tartare sauce, plus mushroom farfalle with blue cheese and a hazelnut and apple salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to make pan-fried scallops with sweet chilli rice and dressed greens, followed by quick brownies.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare lamb lollipops, curry sauce, rice and peas, as well as prawn linguini and Sicilian shaved fennel salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents a real-time cookery lesson, providing tips on how to prepare mustard chicken with greens and quick dauphinoise potatoes, as well as Black Forest affogato.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chicken Dim Sum and Crab Bricks
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in the kitchen and he prepares chicken dim sum with coconut buns, cucumber pickle and hoi sin sauce, plus 'crackin' crab briks', couscous salad and salsa.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares Trapani-style rigatoni with griddled chicory salad, rocket and Parmesan salad, and a limoncello trifle dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to cook crispy duck and hoisin lettuce parcels, before preparing chicken cacciatore, spaghetti and smoky tomato sauce.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks chicken skewers with satay sauce, which he serves with a hot noodle salad, followed by fruit and mint sugar.

programme.title: Gok's Chinese Takeaway
programme.desc: Gok Wan embarks on a journey to visit Chinese communities around the globe to discover their take on Chinese food outside of China.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits New Jersey to take on the Ludicrous Wings challenge - consuming 12 super spicy hot wings in 15 minutes or less.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Syracuse, New York, Adam Richman takes on the Frittata Challenge - a breakfast dish weighing more than 6lb.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Portland, Maine, where he attempts the Manimal Challenge to eat a 4lb meal in 20 minutes or less.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman's journey takes him to Niagara Falls, where he takes on an Italian food challenge that includes 10 plates of food that must be eaten in 90 minutes.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman's culinary quest for the best traditional food takes him to Butte, Montana, where he takes on the Jumboli challenge - which means he must eat a 5lb stromboli.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Sacramento, California, Adam Richman takes on the Knucklehead Challenge - 5lb of chilli-smothered hot dogs.

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert visits Cafe No Fur in Las Vegas, where the owners - a model and a former poker player - must change their stubborn ways if they want the business to survive.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a selection of dishes for a casual office party, including maple bacon dip with apples, Italian cheese sticks, and crab Rangoon and fried wontons.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes an edible 'thank you' package featuring grape lemonade, old-fashioned chicken stew and a sweet lemon and raspberry cream cake.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree uses chicken in dishes including buffalo chicken burgers, Tex-Mex pulled chicken and balsamic chicken.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares shrimp scampi stuffed shells and a nacho cheese casserole, and she makes double portions so she can freeze half of it and save it for another time.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree puts a twist on classic ranch dishes, and she prepares a low-calorie courgette carbonara, spicy brussels caesar salad and chocolate brownies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond revisit some of her favourite recipes from her books. She cooks up chicken fried steak medallions, pantry pasta and butter pecan French toast.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond creates four delicious make-ahead summer treats. She makes a party-worthy blackberry crepe cake, followed by strawberry prosecco peach jellies.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes fairground food, starting with bacon mac and cheese eggrolls. Next, there are classic county fair turkey legs served with a sweet and spicy barbecue sauce.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares some of Ladd's favourite foods, including spatchcock BBQ chicken, thin and crispy waffle fries and for dessert spoon cake with gooey chocolate frosting.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree fills her freezer with Tex-Mex favourites, including green chili pork stew, mac and cheese, and a veggie taco salad.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef makes a high-octane pit stop at the world-famous Sonoma Raceway. Nestled in amongst Sonoma's vineyards, James discovers the preparations for the IndyCar season finale and gets driven around the track by American motorsport hero Mario Andretti. James cooks trackside before visiting a new foodie Sonoma hotspot, simply called Shed. After a wholesome lunch made with only the best local ingredients, James gets invited to Mario's nearby vineyard for a glass of wine and to discuss the thrills and spills of motorsport.

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: James enters the Los Angeles in style while driving a vintage Porsche. After a visit to an incredible food market in Santa Monica, he heads to the beach to cook up a storm. He also meets a pensioner who happens to be a fitness coach, drops in on old friend and chef-to-the-stars Wolfgang Puck at his Beverly Hills restaurant CUT and finishes his visit with a bite of his favourite pizza.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares another selection of quick meals, including crispy Camembert parcels, an autumn salad with cranberry dip and a golden chicken with braised greens and potato gratin.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares a quick meal of steak Indian-style, with spinach and paneer salad, naan bread and mango dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including fish baps, mushy peas and tartare sauce, plus mushroom farfalle with blue cheese and a hazelnut and apple salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to make pan-fried scallops with sweet chilli rice and dressed greens, followed by quick brownies.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver continues to demonstrate his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare lamb lollipops, curry sauce, rice and peas, as well as prawn linguini and Sicilian shaved fennel salad.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares Trapani-style rigatoni with griddled chicory salad, rocket and Parmesan salad, and a limoncello trifle dessert.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to cook crispy duck and hoisin lettuce parcels, before preparing chicken cacciatore, spaghetti and smoky tomato sauce.

programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks chicken skewers with satay sauce, which he serves with a hot noodle salad, followed by fruit and mint sugar.

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin meets Kate Armstrong, who bought 16th-century South Ayrshire castle Cassillis House. She has spent four years struggling to restore every one of its 110 rooms, while also taking on the responsibility of preserving the story of Clan Kennedy, whose members called it their home for 21 generations. The historical investigation reveals a transition from defensive fort to pleasure palace, as well as a link to one of the most famous murder mysteries in Scottish history.

programme.title: Restoration Home
programme.desc: Caroline Quentin meets Kate Armstrong, who bought 16th-century South Ayrshire castle Cassillis House. She has spent four years struggling to restore every one of its 110 rooms, while also taking on the responsibility of preserving the story of Clan Kennedy, whose members called it their home for 21 generations. The historical investigation reveals a transition from defensive fort to pleasure palace, as well as a link to one of the most famous murder mysteries in Scottish history.

programme.title: At the Earth's Core (1976)
programme.desc: A Victorian professor invents a super-powerful tunnelling machine that can dig its way through the Earth's crust. To impress his financial backer he gives a demonstration, but his invention malfunctions and bores a channel to the very centre of the Earth - where they discover a prehistoric human race enslaved by flying telepathic monsters. Sci-fi adventure based on the book by Edgar Rice Burroughs, with Peter Cushing, Doug McClure, Caroline Munro and Cy Grant.

programme.desc: The Archangel Michael turns his back on Heaven and travels to a small-town diner to protect a pregnant waitress and her unborn child from God's wrath. Action fantasy, starring Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Lucas Black, Tyrese Gibson, Adrianne Palicki and Willa Holland.

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Soho and Milllwall, with fascinating facts for locals and tourists alike. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. Dr Harrison's plans to become better acquainted with Sophy are thwarted by Caroline Tomkinson and Clara Smith, Mr Carter takes pity on an illiterate 10-year-old and Miss Matty is shaken to see a face from her past. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Eileen Atkins.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Canary Wharf and Southbank.

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Siobhan has Dominic promoted, but the pressure to confess to Hari mounts as he gets increasingly excited by her pregnancy. Trudi determines to win Richard back, but takes things further than she intended, while Katie desperately tries to contact Sam, and when he appears in the middle of the night, is forced to tell him the whole story of his father's death.

programme.title: Prisoners of the Lost Universe (1983)
programme.desc: A scientist's teleportation device accidentally transports two mismatched modern-day people to a fantasy world, where they must prevent a barbaric warlord from obtaining advanced weaponry. Sci-fi adventure, starring Richard Hatch and Kay Lenz.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: It may be late but you can rely on Magic to keep you company all night long with nothing but our greatest hits.

programme.title: Brighten Up Your Breakfast!
programme.desc: Let us brighten up your morning with some of our favourite feel-good songs!.

programme.title: Tearjerkers! Through The Years
programme.desc: Here are Magic we want you to feel all ranges of emotion from the Good, Bad and the Ugly which includes Tearjerkers.

programme.title: I'm A 90s Baby!
programme.desc: Join Eloise Carr for a playlist full of 90s tunes! Expect classics from Spice Girls, Bryan Adams, Shania Twain and more....

programme.title: Sophie Ellis Bextor's Kitchen Disco
programme.desc: Join the Queen of the Kitchen Disco dancefloor Sophie Ellis-Bextor as she guides you through a playlist of her ultimate party tunes! Moloko, Madonna and Chaka Khan all feature..

programme.title: Don't Stop The Party!
programme.desc: It's party time! Expect back-to-back hits all night long...

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy game show, with Sean Lock and Greg Davies taking on Jon Richardson and Holly Walsh. Susie Dent is joined by Vic Reeves in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson join forces with Jason Manford and Roisin Conaty respectively. Sam Simmons helps the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 68-year-old professional actor visits St George's Hospital after injuring his shoulder while rushing to catch a train, and a check-up indicates he may need corrective surgery to set things right, but further assessment suggests he might be living with a much more serious condition. An octogenarian couple are rushed in to A&E after being knocked over by a motorcyclist while crossing the road, and the police maintain an active presence as paramedics bring in a man who has collapsed after a suspected drug overdose. Plus, an 88-year-old woman with a swollen leg discusses her ill-fated marriage to a much younger man nearly four decades ago.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tamsin is looking for her dream holiday home on the Greek island of Crete. She and her best friend Emma, who she has known since meeting at nursery school, have enjoyed many a holiday on the island, and now Tamsin is ready to have her own bolthole there. Laura Hamilton works within her budget of £100,000 to find a suitable property.

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as the UK's national dish, and heads to Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. Kate Quilton goes Down Under to find out about a surprising new meat coming into our supermarkets and Matt Tebbutt heads to Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are famously expensive.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows London-based Sri Lankan couple Kulan and Kamala five properties for their budget of £200,000 in Portugal's Algarve region. However, it remains to be seen which property has the most 'wow' factor to become the accountants' dream holiday home.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Thomas and Doreen from Sunderland have been dreaming of owning a holiday home in Spain since their first anniversary there 39 years ago. Scarlette Douglas searches far and wide to find them the perfect property in eastern Andalucía for their £55,000 budget. But will it be a modern apartment near the sea or a traditional cave house in the countryside that wins their hearts?.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Maggie have been together for 35 years and are looking for a holiday home in Barbados, where they can escape British winters and make the most of the tropical climate. With a budget of £350,000, Jasmine Harman uses her extensive knowledge of the island to find the best properties for the pair to choose between.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in Sheffield. Scientists Lois and Ahmed's strategic approach has so far seen them lose out on eight houses, being outbid by just a few thousand pounds each time. With a toddler in tow, and living with Lois's parents, the heat is on for Kirstie to find their own family home. Phil is with Liz and Luke, who are set on the rural areas around the city, close to the Peak District.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alex Sullivan hosts the first party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress with her birthday party-themed evening. However, an uncomfortable reunion between two former school friends gets the night off to a bad start, and a less than satisfactory dessert leaves the host with little to celebrate.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Scott Johnson hosts an 'Essex Glam-themed' night for the second dinner party of the week in Chelmsford, Essex. His menu initially impresses his guests, until they realise he has taken some shortcuts with his preparations. However, a bigger problem emerges when former classmates John Mabey and Martin Young renew old hostilities, so Scott tries to lighten the mood by taking everyone for a dance in 'Essex's smallest disco' - his kitchen.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Deb Croghan hosts the third dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, and hopes to impress her guests with a tarts and vicars-style evening. Following an uncomfortable game of guessing everyone's age, she perks up the evening with an unusual entertainment - a cucumber-based sport she claims is a traditional family pastime.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old hot-tub salesman John Mabey hosts the fourth dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, setting out to woo his guests with a Shakespearean evening featuring an Italian-style menu, but when his food comes close to a complete fiasco, he turns to theatrics to save the day - including asking his guests to act out Romeo and Juliet.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Martin Young hosts the final dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress his guests by throwing a Caribbean-themed evening. The diners are pleasantly surprised by the quality of his food and shocked when he reveals a secret talent, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire, where two of the guests are less than impressed when the breakfast table is laid with steak knives.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Railway Inn near Hull in East Yorkshire, where young couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize feel the pressure at breakfast time.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Driftwood B&B in Weymouth, where guest Lygia prepares to party when she spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman prides herself on a luxury stay. But a surprise leads to criticism from one couple.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Genice and Cathy want Lydia and Luke to shed some light on the wardrobe situation.

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Sarah Moore renovates a house on the Greek island of Skiathos after buying it without seeing it during lockdown. Having spent many years holidaying and working on the island, Sarah has developed a deep connection to Skiathos and has long dreamt of owning a house there. The family visit the house for the first time and learn about the complications that come with renovating a house in a country with different rules and regulations.

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Llyr Jones' hill farm in north Wales and learns how he has focused on making a profit and protecting the environment since taking over the farm as a teenager. She works alongside Vicky and Sian in the egg packing unit, on an early morning calf-feeding routine and rounding up sheep while taking a crash course in Welsh language sheep dog commands.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zaki, 63, recently underwent a tonsillectomy following a diagnosis of throat cancer, but he has come to A&E after suffering a serious bleed. Doctors try to save 10-month-old baby Amy, who stopped breathing at home, while 21-year-old expectant father Craig appears to have had a miraculous escape after a motocross accident, but has he learnt his lesson?.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighty-four-year-old Paula is referred to St George's for urgent treatment, after a routine blood test detected that she has a dangerously high level of potassium in her blood. Meanwhile, 74-year-old Derek is brought into A&E after suffering a suspected stroke. As he goes for emergency surgery, his devoted wife Mary is determined to help him recover. Plus, 31-year-old fireman Glenn arrives with a suspected abscess in his throat; he is joined by his twin brother Dean, and the pair prove to be inseparable.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.sub-title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown Christmas Special
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show's version of the popular and long-running words-and-numbers quiz. Regular team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Johnny Vegas and Katherine Ryan to provide more comic innuendos, festive surprises and laughs aplenty. Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent takes her usual place in Dictionary Corner with David O'Doherty, while mathematics whizz Rachel Riley is on hand to provide the letters and numbers.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Pub landlord Tony is brought in with burnt legs as a result of his barbecue gas cylinder exploding - made slightly worse by the fact he was only wearing boxer shorts at the time. Henry, a 93-year-old war veteran, is rushed in with severe breathing difficulties, and builder Bill was knocked unconscious after falling off his shed. His CT scan reveals he has broken his neck in three places, and he may need surgery to avoid damage to his spinal cord.

programme.title: Motor Pickers
programme.desc: David wants an electric car that's fun to drive and has space for his growing family. With a maximum budget of £60,000, classic car expert Paul Cowland and builder-restorer Helen Stanley hunt for a dream motor.

programme.title: Motor Pickers
programme.desc: A client is willing to spend £85,000 on a fast, loud and pretty performance sports car. He challenges classic car expert Paul Cowland and builder-restorer Helen Stanley to pick out the car of his dreams.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope, revealing their production. How are objects including shuffleboard tables made?.

programme.desc: Geoff Edgers examines items associated with four 'great escapes', including a monocular that saved a stranded pilot's life, and a rifle that allowed a war hero to cheat death.

programme.desc: The presenter examines the story of the last days of the Sioux and the clashes between Native American tribes and Americans, using unseen 3D stereographic images.

programme.desc: A 4x4 customiser knows his Land Rover Defenders - but supercars are unfamiliar territory for him. Helen and Paul find him a dream car with a big budget of £150,000

programme.title: Stop the Wedding (2016)
programme.desc: Young attorney Anna Colton discovers her naive, widowed Aunt Belle is about to tie the knot with Sean Castleberry, a Hollywood star known for his many failed marriages. Determined to stop the wedding, she teams up with Castleberry's doctor son, Clay, who does not seem too keen on gaining a new step-mother, and while the pair initially find each other irritating, a spark of attraction develops. Romantic drama, based on the novel by Stephanie Bond, starring Rachel Boston and Niall Matter.

programme.title: The Balmoral Hotel: An Extraordinary Year

programme.title: Champions League Magazine

programme.title: Saturday GAA Live
programme.desc: Derry v Dublin (Throw-in 5.00pm). All the action from the Allianz Football League Division Two encounter from Celtic Park. Last season ended in disappointment for both teams, with Derry missing out on a place in the final and promotion by one point, and Dublin being relegated after finishing bottom of Division One. Damian Lawlor presents, with analysis from Cora Staunton, Paul Flynn and Peter Canavan.

programme.title: URC Live
programme.desc: Dragons v Connacht (Kick-off 7.35pm). Daire O'Brien presents all the action from the clash at Rodney Parade. The Dragons have struggled so far this season and find themselves towards the bottom of the table, while Connacht will be looking to put a run of form together to boost their chances of qualifying for the quarter-finals. With commentary by Des Curran and Fiona Coghlan.

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle (2017)
programme.desc: Having saved the world once, secret agents Eggsy and Merlin join forces with their US counterparts to bring down a psychotic femme fatale. Thankfully they are assisted by a veteran hero brought back from the dead, and cross paths with a kidnapped Elton John and a couple of killer robot dogs along the way. Director Matthew Vaughn's comedy adventure sequel, starring Taron Egerton, Colin Firth, Mark Strong and Julianne Moore.

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps two friends with a budget of £250,000 who are hoping to buy a property in Puglia, Italy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping Feature. Your one-stop-shop for all things cruise; bringing you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The fourth day of the competition sees Margie Cooper and Mark Stacey looking for valuable items in the New Forest in Hampshire, before heading to an auction challenge in Sherborne, Dorset.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: In the last leg of their journey, antiques experts Margie Cooper and Mark Stacey travel from the Devon village of Hele to the final auction in Torquay, where they compete to make the most profit from the collectibles they have bought along the way. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Dr Lee treats a man who has large growths on his nose that impair his breathing. Meanwhile, Marie has an unsightly lump on her forehead.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Gerard has nearly a hundred lumps varying in size all over his body. Meanwhile, patient Eric has a large bump on his head.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Traci's confidence was destroyed after years of bullying about the bumps that have plagued her face for 20 years, while Ravon has a unique dangling growth on his leg.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo Salt and her daughter Frankie hope to buy a holiday home near Benalmadena in Spain's Costa del Sol for the whole family to enjoy quality time in. Working to their budget of £130,000, Ben Hillman shows them five potential properties.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lynn and Gerald are looking for a holiday home in the north of Spain's Murcia region, where they can enjoy the Mediterranean sunshine and numerous golf courses the area has to offer. Ben Hillman lines up five options iwthin their budget of £100,000, hoping at least one will encourage the pair to make an offer.

programme.title: The Edinburgh Auction House
programme.desc: Sybelle helps a client downsize only to find a diamond encrusted gold nugget, but she will need to test it back at the saleroom to determine its value.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: An off-duty doctor tries to save an unconscious lorry driver whose vehicle has caught fire, and an air ambulance is sent to rescue a pensioner who has been knocked over.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: A boy needs to be rescued after being injured while jumping into Whitby Harbour, and a biker causes an accident when he slips into a diabetic coma on the road.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Air ambulances come to the aid of pensioners trapped in their car following a collision. A motorcyclist with a head injury claims he is still able to ride his badly damaged bike.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: A cyclist fights for life, a heart attack victim is raced to hospital and a herd of cattle has to be moved so the chopper can land on a clifftop to help an injured walker.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In the Irish resort of Skerries, the crew run to the station when strong winds sweep a teenager on a paddleboard towards the busy shipping lanes of the Irish Sea, while in the Bristol Channel, among the many yachts taking advantage of a fresh summer breeze, one loses a crew member overboard. While the crowds are heading home at the end of a busy summer's day in Cleethorpes, two 13-year-old girls find themselves alone, cut off and at risk of drowning on a sandbank rapidly disappearing under a fast-rising tide.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: TAPS braces for a storm of paranormal activity at the Mississippi Coast Coliseum. Alongside Steve Shippy, they investigate the frightening events shaking employees.

programme.title: Unexplained: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: In Massachusetts, Zack discovers a secret room which is full of deadly surprises. Later, an urban explorer spends the night in a house of horrors.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A Civil War spirit strolls along a battlefield, a researcher finds the remains of a sea dragon, and a ghost clocks in for the graveyard shift.

programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows.
