programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the memorable Group A match, which came from Wembley Stadium. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from John Barnes and Jack Charlton, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: Night Vision
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from across Scotland.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates flavour-packed recipes.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny faces three target challenges, but will he succeed and avoid a gunge-filled forfeit?.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host..

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: An accident at an asteroid-based mining facility sends the rock hurtling toward the Sun, with crewman Ned Tedford still on-site. Alan and Kayo deploy Thunderbird Three for the rescue mission, but when a rogue solar flare knocks out their sensors, they are forced to find a way to alter the asteroid's trajectory so that it loops around the sun instead of plummeting to its ultra-hot surface. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rasmus Hardiker and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy challenges MK to deliver an order in an allotted time to the Monkey King, so MK goes through obstacles that challenge his focus in order to accomplish his goal..

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Demon Bull King's family has found a mysterious power source that will allow them to reclaim their former glory, but it's locked behind an ancient gate. The key to it, which can open any door, was given to MK as thanks for saving the city over and over - after messing around with the key, Red Son finds them. A game of cat and mouse ensues as DBK's family tries to get the key and MK and Mei attempt to keep it away..

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: Bumbling detective Inspector Gadget battles the forces of M.A.D. with the aid of his gadgets and gizmos, his niece Penny and her intrepid dog, Brain.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is fed up with being chosen all the time - every time a student is summoned to the blackboard or asked to perform a chore, he's the one picked out! When Mr Brick plans to choose someone to be John-Cedrick's partner for the I Love My School civic project, Mo decides to use the Spectral Spectre to avoid that fate. He wants to become invisible, but when his best friend Lenny gets chosen instead, Mo will have to get his friend out of this terrible situation..

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Ever since they found out that Hollywood film star Timothy Bloom is JC's cousin, JC's 'courtiers' follow him around the school. Sam and Stella are shocked at his abuse of power, but Mo doesn't really care... that is, until he is forbidden from entering the school bathroom as it is now exclusively used as JC's headquarters. This is the last straw - determined to eliminate JC's 'royal court', Mo asks the Sceptre for the power to turn whoever he wants into his own courtier..

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at the house by Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts and former Welsh rugby union star Scott Quinnell, with recipes for tagine, jalfrezi chicken and steak. Plus, chefs Sabrina Gidda and Daniel Galmiche serve up some mouth-watering dishes of their own.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes featuring herbs, cooking a breakfast dish of huevos rancheros with pico de gallo, and a fish sandwich with a tamarind mayo. Thuy Pham marries herbs with Vietnamese speciality banh xeo pancakes, while actress and keen cook Lisa Snowdon makes pan-fried mackerel with warm herb and rice salad.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

With analysis from Luke Harvey and Andrew Thornton, reports by Oli Bell and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts another charity edition of the game show, with Lady Leshurr, Gabby Logan and Adam Thomas trying to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the good cause of their choice.

programme.desc: Following the ebb and flow of the Second World War Battle of Britain, including the contributions made by people on the ground. Featuring eye-witness accounts from members of the public who were youthful spectators of the day Winston Churchill described as the 'crux of the battle'.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Berwick-upon-Tweed to the Isle of Man, beginning in the Northumberland village of Bardon Mill. He follows in the footsteps of Victorian archaeologists at Hadrian's Wall, discovers how the introduction of ticket machines transformed 19th-century train travel and learns about the impact of railways on the west Cumbrian town of Wigton.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Cumbria, where he visits the Sellafield site that reprocesses fuel from nuclear reactors, drinks a Victorian brew made from the waters of Cockermouth and explores a Japanese-inspired garden created in the 19th century.

programme.desc: Derek heads to Scotland in the mother of all rainstorms to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible. Plus, Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock up.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There's a surprise for Derek in Hull - an MGSA sports car that once had a tree growing through it. Plus, in North Wales, Alan Holmes is selling his son's Ford Escort RS 1600i.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up a rare Ford Zodiac Farnham Estate, while Dave heads for an isolated tent in the Midlands to collect a Triumph Toledo.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a ghost town in Colorado, the remnants of an industrial enterprise in Puerto Rico and a remote village on Cyprus.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a jungle refuge concealing a story of royal deceit, nuclear bunkers infiltrated by outsiders, and a haunted hospital marked by scandal.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a beachside resort with ties to the Russian mafia, a windswept base hiding lifesaving technology, and a site in Iowa plagued by its past.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. Across the border in San Sebastian, Michael learns how diplomacy brought Britain and Spain closer together and rides on a hair-raising scenic railway. Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Gruber finishes the paintings and the spy camera sent from London has fallen into a vineyard where the peasants are refusing to work for fear of being shot.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General von Klinkerhoffen visits the vineyard where Rene and the Resistance are working, and jeopardises their scheme to return the British airmen home.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: First episode of the Second World War comedy set in German-occupied France about the misadventures of womanising cafe owner Rene Artois, whose cafe is commandeered by the Resistance to shelter two airmen. Starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Agdam, a city in Azerbaijan razed to the ground in a conflict decided by a new weapon of war.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Berwick-upon-Tweed to the Isle of Man, beginning in the Northumberland village of Bardon Mill. He follows in the footsteps of Victorian archaeologists at Hadrian's Wall, discovers how the introduction of ticket machines transformed 19th-century train travel and learns about the impact of railways on the west Cumbrian town of Wigton.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Cumbria, where he visits the Sellafield site that reprocesses fuel from nuclear reactors, drinks a Victorian brew made from the waters of Cockermouth and explores a Japanese-inspired garden created in the 19th century.

programme.title: Scouting for Toys
programme.desc: Featuring Graham Hamilton, who has collected every Matchbox model car released between 1961 to 1982: amassing more than 2,000 vehicles, many of them incredibly rare..

programme.title: Scouting for Toys
programme.desc: The auctioneers try to value a remarkable set of toy theatres - some more than 150 years old with expert advice from Pollock's Toy Museum.

programme.desc: The incredible efforts to ensure that the hastily constructed temporary fix around the damaged reactor at Chernobyl becomes a permanent solution, known as the New Safe Confinement.
